Alert Name: bush
Congress eyes Sallie Mae/White House talks
Student loan company chairman sold $18 million of stock after meeting to discuss federal budget , before price drop.
05/24/07 05:31 PM, EDT
Staff at student loan company Sallie Mae planned to meet with Bush administration officials to discuss the 2008 federal budget two months before its public release triggered a drop in the company's share price, according to a company document released by congressional investigators Thursday.
